decks.notes: The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Devourer of Destiny. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble help to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Sowing Mycospawn to generate additional threats. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-to-answer threats while using control elements to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to generate mana quickly with rituals and medallions, then cast a flurry of spells to deal massive damage to the opponent through cards like Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes cards like Wish to find key pieces or answers when needed. The combination of card draw and spell recursion from Past in Flames allows the deck to consistently execute its game plan of building up to a game-winning combo turn. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high amount of damage in a short amount of time.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also features powerful creatures like Emperor of Bones and Thought-Knot Seer to quickly close out the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Nihil Spellbomb provide additional utility and versatility. The land base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the efficiency of Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through card draw and graveyard manipulation. Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth provide mana ramp and fixing, while Sheoldred's Edict and Thoughtseize help to eliminate threats. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile threat and disruptor, while Orcish Bowmasters and Dauthi Voidwalker provide additional creature-based disruption. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources and win through attrition and incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing land ramp and mana acceleration to quickly bring out Primeval Titan and trigger powerful combos, such as using Scapeshift to find Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and deal massive amounts of damage. Amulet of Vigor ensures lands come into play untapped, while cards like Explore and Arboreal Grazer help ramp up quickly. The inclusion of utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Commercial District provide additional options for the player. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently set up powerful combos and overwhelm the opponent with its land-based strategy.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain a strong board presence through countering spells and removal, controlling the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by efficiently handling threats with cards such as Terminus and Prismatic Ending, while utilizing card advantage and selection with Opt and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. This deck prioritizes a balance of removal, counter magic, and card advantage to outlast opponents and secure victory.
